slides.title: Ecosystems
slides.content:
# Ecosystems üèûÔ∏è

## Components
| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Biotic | Plants, animals |
| Abiotic | Water, sun, soil |

## Types
- Terrestrial (forest, desert)
- Aquatic (freshwater, marine)

slides.title: Food Webs
slides.content:
# Food Webs üï∏Ô∏è

## Trophic Levels
| Level | Organisms |
|-------|----------|
| Producers | Plants |
| Primary consumers | Herbivores |
| Secondary | Carnivores |
| Tertiary | Top predators |

## 10% Rule
Only 10% energy transfers to next level

slides.title: Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: How much energy transfers between trophic levels?

slides.title: Cycles
slides.content:
# Biogeochemical Cycles ‚ôªÔ∏è

| Cycle | Key Process |
|-------|------------|
| Carbon | Photosynthesis/respiration |
| Nitrogen | Fixation by bacteria |
| Water | Evaporation/precip |
| Phosphorus | Rock weathering |

slides.title: Populations
slides.content:
# Population Dynamics üìä

## Growth Types
| Type | Pattern |
|------|--------|
| Exponential | J-curve |
| Logistic | S-curve |

## Carrying Capacity (K)
Max population environment can support

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üéâ

- Ecosystems: Biotic + abiotic
- 10% energy rule
- Cycles: C, N, H‚ÇÇO, P
- Carrying capacity limits growth
